title: Ancient Civilizations Recall
description: Test your knowledge of the great civilizations that shaped our world!

questions.question: Which ancient civilization built the pyramids at Giza?
questions.explanation: The Ancient Egyptians built the pyramids at Giza around 2560 BC during the Old Kingdom period.

questions.question: In which modern country was the ancient civilization of Mesopotamia located?
questions.explanation: Mesopotamia ('land between the rivers') was located in present-day Iraq, between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization developed the first known writing system, called cuneiform?
questions.explanation: The Sumerians developed cuneiform writing around 3400 BC in Mesopotamia, using wedge-shaped marks on clay tablets.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization built Machu Picchu?
questions.explanation: The Inca Empire built Machu Picchu in the 15th century as an estate for Emperor Pachacuti, high in the Andes Mountains of Peru.

questions.question: Which civilization created the concept of democracy in the 5th century BC?
questions.explanation: Ancient Athens developed the world's first known democracy around 508 BC under the reforms of Cleisthenes.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization is known for its advanced plumbing and the cities of Mohenjo-daro and Harappa?
questions.explanation: The Indus Valley Civilization (c. 3300-1300 BC) had remarkably advanced urban planning including sophisticated drainage and plumbing systems.

questions.question: Which civilization built the Colosseum in Rome?
questions.explanation: The Roman Empire built the Colosseum between 70-80 AD under Emperors Vespasian and Titus. It could hold up to 80,000 spectators.

questions.question: Which Mesoamerican civilization is known for its elaborate calendar system and pyramids at Chichen Itza?
questions.explanation: The Maya civilization developed an incredibly accurate calendar system and built impressive pyramids, including El Castillo at Chichen Itza.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization used hieroglyphics as their writing system?
questions.explanation: Ancient Egyptians used hieroglyphics for over 3,000 years, from around 3200 BC until the 4th century AD.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization is credited with inventing the alphabet that influenced Greek and Latin scripts?
questions.explanation: The Phoenicians developed an alphabet around 1050 BC that became the basis for Greek, Latin, Arabic, and Hebrew writing systems.

questions.question: Which dynasty built the Great Wall of China?
questions.explanation: The Qin Dynasty began construction of the Great Wall around 221 BC, though later dynasties, especially the Ming, greatly expanded it.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization was centered on the island of Crete and featured the palace of Knossos?
questions.explanation: The Minoan civilization flourished on Crete from approximately 2700 to 1450 BC and built the elaborate palace of Knossos.

questions.question: Which Mesoamerican civilization built Tenochtitlan, the site of modern-day Mexico City?
questions.explanation: The Aztec Empire built their capital Tenochtitlan on an island in Lake Texcoco around 1325. It was one of the largest cities in the world at the time.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization traded throughout the Mediterranean and founded the city of Carthage?
questions.explanation: The Phoenicians were master seafarers and traders who founded Carthage (in modern Tunisia) around 814 BC as a major trading hub.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization built the Parthenon temple dedicated to the goddess Athena?
questions.explanation: Ancient Athens built the Parthenon on the Acropolis between 447 and 432 BC, dedicated to Athena, the city's patron goddess.
